meanings.sent1: The scientist used a polarographic method to analyze the solution.
meanings.sent2: The polarographic technique helped determine the properties of the substance.
meanings.sent3: The polarographic experiment was so precise, it could even detect tiny changes.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail was polarographic, capturing every nuance of the data.
meanings.sent5: The polarographic analysis revealed hidden patterns in the results.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the measurement of electrical conductivity in a solution.
meanings.sent1: The polarographic device accurately measured the solution's conductivity.
meanings.sent2: Researchers used a polarographic approach to assess the electrical properties of the liquid.
meanings.sent3: The polarographic reading was so high, it seemed like the liquid was glowing!
meanings.sent4: His understanding of the subject was polarographic, illuminating new insights.
meanings.sent5: The polarographic measurement provided a clear picture of the solution's behavior.
